organization: Law Offices of Dowd, Bloch, Bennett & Cervone
description_of_request: Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, 5 ILCS 140/1, et. seq., this is to request the following records to the extent they are not privileged from disclosure: 1. For employees performing security services who are covered under a collective bargaining agreement, a copy of the most recent collective bargaining agreement; 2. For employees performing security services who are not covered under a collective bargaining agreement, records or information showing: a. Classifications and pay ranges within those classifications; b. Policies governing their terms and conditions of employment. This office agrees to pay all fees associated with retrieval and copying of the requested documents. Please advise me as soon as practicable of the costs associated with  this request, if any, in order that they may be paid promptly. Pursuant to Section 3(c) of the Act, your compliance or written denial of this request shall be provided within five business days after your receipt of this request unless the time for response is lawfully extended. Pursuant to Section 9(a) of the Act, if this request is denied in whole or part, please provide in writing the reasons for the denial, including a detailed factual basis for the application of any exemption claimed, and the names and titles or positions of each person responsible for the denial.

Under the Illinois Freedom of Information Act, please provide electronic records of the participants of city-funded summer programs. Please provide this data between 2009 and present. For each record please provide the following: 1.) Instead of the name, please provide a unique identifier; 2.) Age of the child; 3.) Residence zip code; 4.) Race of child; 5.) Type of summer program; 6.) Location of the program; 7.) Cost of program. Please provide the data in an electronic format. The Chicago Reader is a non-profit news organization and the information requested is for the public interest I ask that you waive all fees associated with this request. Thanks in advance for your attention to this request. If you have any questions, feel free to contact me at mzamudio@chicagoreporter.com or (312) 673-3878. I look forward to your response.

Requests the names, titles and e-mail addresses of all employees in the Chicago Public Library system. I {Ms. Hawkins} could not use the city's FOIA form, it would not attach to this e-mail. My address is 15265 Calitonia Drive, Markham, IL 60428

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act/Open Records Act, this is a request for a copy of the following records: an electronic copy of "any" and "all" vendor (transfer of property or services) payee payments for the years 2008-2013 broken down by year. Production shall include the vendor name; vendor address; vendor city; vendor state name; vendor zip code; Check Date/ ACH Date; Check Number/ACH code; Check Amount/ ACH Amount; department; agency; type of payment (i.e. contract, grant, etc.)and description of products or services/ purpose of payment. The principal purpose of this request is to make this information more accessible to the public and to access and disseminate information regarding the health, safety, and welfare of the general public. This request is not principally for personal or commercial benefit. Our agency is just exercising the general rights of the public. For these reasons we are requesting a waiver of fees. If there is a charge for this service please obtain my approval in writing prior to proceeding with request. All documents can be e-mailed to illinois@openthebooks.com or mailed in electronic format (preferred format would be .csv or xls). If any documents are not provided in the format specified, please provide the state or federal statutes relied upon for that decision. If any record or portion of a record responsive to this request is contained in a record or portion of a record deemed unresponsive to the request, our agency would like to inspect the entire document. Under the Open Records Act/Freedom of Information Act, all non-exempt portions of any partially-exempt documents must be disclosed. If any records or portions of records are withheld, please state the exemption on which you rely, the basis on which the exemption is invoked, and the name of the individual responsible for the decision. Thank you for your prompt consideration of my request. If you have any questions, or if I can be of any assistance, please e-mail me at illinois@openthebooks.com.
Requests copy of credit report.

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act (5 ILCS 140/1 to 11), I hereby request the following records: A copy of the grant proposal, application and award letter relating to the Chicago Public Library Foundation's proposal to the Knight Foundation's News Challenge "to offer Chicago residents Wi-Fi hotspots for up to three weeks at a time, in addition to one-on-one digital literacy and skills coaching and access to online tutorials." This program is being referred to as Internet to Go and is mentioned in this press release http://www.cityofchicago.org/city/en/depts/mayor/press_room/press_releases/2014/jun/mayor-emanuel-announces-chicago-public-library-awarded-grant-for-html?cq_ck=14035394338882. I allso request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest. The requested documents will be made available to the  general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed  by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage. In the event that fees cannaot be waived, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fuffilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available of CD-ROM if not. Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the state requires.

I am a Swedish genealogist who have found out that one of my ancestors moved to USA in 1920. Johan Fritiof Rydstrom (John Rydstrom) born 1898-10-04 in Skatelov, Kronoberg, Sweden. He came to USA in September 1920. In 1940 he lived as a lodger as West Addison Street in Chicago, Cook, Illinois. I would be much obliged if you could provide me further information about his life in the USA e.g. marriage, children, employment and date of decease.

requestor_name: Adrian J. Bleifuss Prados, Attorney at Law
organization: Beth Maschinot, Jewish Voice for Peace
description_of_request: This letter constitutes a non-commercial request for records pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act 5 ILCS 140/1 and corresponding regulations, seeking the following records: 1. The full copies of any contracts between thew City of Chicago and/or its agencies and G4S Secure Solutions, and/ or G4S USA and/or the Wackenhut Corporation, and/or and contractor known to be a subsidiary of G4S plc (Hereinafter "G4S")--incuding any pending bids for contracts place by G4S. 2. Any and all records identifying the names and /or coprorate identities of any persons or companies that placed competing bids for contracts that were ultimately awarded to G4S. 3. Any and all records describing or tabulating the quotes or sums of money for which competeing bidders ofered to perform contracts that were ultimately awarded to G4S. 4. Any and all copies or records of public advertisements or notices placed by the City of Chicago or its agencies, in order to solicit bids for contracts that were ultimately awarded to G4S. 5. Any and all  records relating to the policies whereby the services performed by G4S are evaluated or reviewed by the City of Chicago, its agencies, and /or personnel. 6. Any and all records identifying any city employee or official responsible for overseeing, reviewing, and/ or evaluating services performed by G4S. 7. Any and al recored relating to complaints regarding the conduct of G4S and/ or its employees, including complaints made by members of the public, plaintiffs in lawsuits. or personnel of either G4S or the City.  8. Any and all records dating from the last 365 days, including emails, memos or letters constituting correspondence relating to extending contracts with G4S, and/ or expanding the City of Chicago's relationship with G4S. 9. Any and all records relating to, or describing, knowledge on the part of the City of Chicago, its personnel or agencies, regarding services performed by G4S in the State of Israel and/ or the Palestinian Territories.

Please produce the following: 1. Any and all incident reports completed by staff and all complaints by patrons made on or about 11/04/14 related to the incident that Ellyn Weiss Schmitz talked about on Facebook. An incident repoprt is a loose term for any written summary, statement, notice, report or othe documentation of a man using a computer and engaging in sexual arousal as described by Schmitz on Facebook. I am looking to see if the Mt. Washington (sic) Library staff documented her complaint and the incident she complained about in any way. 2. All incident reports completed by Mt. Washington (sic) Library staff in the years 2012, 2013, and 2014. Hear, you may leave out reports of vandalism, theft, and other property related reports. I am interested in reports involving sexual activity, masturbation, pornography being accessed, men acosting women or children, violence, and other situations of that neture. Someone falling down and hurting himself would not be included in this FOIA search but someone being pushed down to the ground by another person would be. Someone spilling water on a computer and damaging it would not be included in this FOIA search but someone masturbating at a computer or arousing himself to porn at a computer would be. 3. All reports where the Mt. Washingtojn (sic) Library staff called the police to come to the Library in the years 2012, 2013, and 2014 and all records of police reports that were generated by those calls. 4. Any video or pictures that the Mt. Washington (sic) Library staff have of the man that Ellyn Weiss Schmitz reports to have seen arousing himself sexually at a computer. 5. The Patron Behavior Policy in effect at the Mt. Washington (sic) Library that would govern behavior such as sexual arousal at a computer in the Library. Is such behavior really allowed as the staff told Ellyn Weiss Schmitz or is this behavior not allowed? For instance, at the Harold Washington Library in downtown Chciago sexual arousal is not allowed and men engaging in sexual arousal, masturbation, or other such activiity are removed and the police are called. Does the Mt. Washington (sic) Library have a different policy from the Harold Washington Library? organization: Jewis Community Council of West Rogers Park
description_of_request: This is a request pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act, 5 ILCS 140. I request records reflecting the following: 1. The total cost of the "Albany Park Library Branch" located at 3401 W. Foster Ave., "Budlong Woods Library Branch" located at 5630 N. Lincoln Ave., "Edgewater Library Branch" located at 1210 W. Elmdale Ave. (hereinafter "The Library"). 2. The breakdown of each major category (as defined by the Chicago Public Libraries) of cost associated with The Library. If no definition of major cost category is available, the total cost is to be broken  down as follows: a. Construction costs. b. Technology associated costs. c. Book stocking costs. d. Other costs. e. Staffing costs for one year. 3. Each and every source of funding used to pay for the cost of The Library. 4. An accounting of the amount each funding source specified in No. 3 above contributed to the final cost of The Library. 5. The minimum requirements needed for the City of Chicago to utilize a lot for a Library. 6. The process required to upgrade an existing library, or build a new library in a Chicago community. The principal purpose of thiis request is to access and disseminate information regarding the welfare of the general public and is not for the principal purpose of personal or commercial benefit. We therefore request a waiver of any fees associated with this request pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/6(c). Should you deem a fee necessary, please contact me for my authorization. Please send all records as an electronic Excel spreadsheet, or if that is not possible, the electronic format which you keep your records.

To Whom It May Concern: Under FOIA, please provide me with PDF copies of all of your FOIA denials (including requests to which you did not provide a response within 5 business days) from January 1, 2013, to present. Please send me the records by email, or if that is not feasible, send them to me over a cloud-based file sharing service like Google Drive. organization: University of Wisconsin-Milwaukee Center for Information Policy Research
description_of_request: The University of Wisconsin-Milwaukee Center for Information Policy Research (http://cipr.uwm.edu) is researching the use of "cloud," web-based, or third-party computer services by public libraries across the country. The Chicago Public Library has been identified as a customer of the BiblioCommons cloud-computing platform, delivering an enhanced and interactive online catalog for your patrons. The project's goal is to analyze how public libraries utilize cloud computing services, as well as how they address and communicate issues that might impact patron privacy. The results of the research will include a summary report of findings, and the development of a set of best practices to guide future implementations of cloud computing in public settings, with the goal of finding a suitable balance between need to provide cost-efective technology-based services while also protecting patron privacy. Your participation in this project will help to ensure that our results provide a complete understanding, as well as useful guidance, for helping us navigate this increasingly important issue. On behalf of the UW-Milwaukee Center for Information Policy Research, and in accordance with the Illinois Freedom of Information Act, 5 ILCS 140, I request copies of the following information: 1. All contracts, agreements, or related legal/vendor documents the Library might have with BiblioCommons, its partners, or representatives. 2. All internal policies, documented procedures, or other materials related to the initial installation and continued implementation of BiblioCommons products and services. 3. All notices provided to patrons related to the Library's collection and use of patron data, including the Library's privacy policy (if one exists), user/patron agreements, or related materials. Please send copies to: Dr. Michael Zimmer; UW-Milwaaukee Center for Information Policy Research; Northwest Quadrant Building B, 3rd Floor; 2025 E. Newport Ave.; Milwaukee, WI 53211. Or by email to: zimmerm@uwm.edu. I look forward to hearing from you in writing within five working days, as required by the Act 5 ILCS 140(3). If you expect a significant delay in responding to this request, please contact with information about when I might expect the requested records. Please also inform me if there are any fees for searching or copying these records. Thank you for your consideration.

Pursuant to the state open records law, 5 Ill. Comp Statute 140, we are requesting public records from the Office of the Mayor relating to the number of employees hired by the local government. The number of CPL employees in 2014 (broken down by zip code of employee if available). Chicago Public Media is a non-profit organization working for the public good. Please provide a receipt indicating the charges. If the requested records exist in electronic form, we  request they be provided in both print and electronic forms. Illinois law requires your office respond to this request within five working days. If you have questions about this request, please contact me at the number below, (312-893-2937). If you chose to deny this request, please provide a written explanation for the denial, including a reference to the specific statutory exemptions upon which you rely. Also, please provide all portions of material that do not fall under the exemptions sited.

This request is not for commercial purposes. I am requesting these records for educational purposes for a class at Loyola University Chicago (I am a student) and therefore request any fees be waived.

SmartProcure is submitting a commercial FOIA request to the Chicago Public Library for any and all electronic purchasing records from 2016-02-09 to current. The request is limited to readily available records without copying, scanning or printing. The specific information requested from your record keeping system is:  1. Purchase order number. If purchase orders are not used a comparable substitute is acceptable,   i.e., invoice, encumbrance, or check number. 2. Purchase date. 3. Line item details (Detailed description of the purchase). 4. Line item quantity. 5. Line item price. 6. Vendor ID number, name, address, contact person and their email address. 7. What is the beginning of your fiscal year? Although not a requirement for fulfillment, the attached document may be helpful as a reference to fulfill this request if the Chicago Public Library stores the records using any of the pre-programmed software reports. Any editable electronic medium is acceptable. Please email the information or use the following web link. There is no file size limitation: http://upload.smartprocure.us/?st=IL&org=ChicagoPublicLibrary. If this request was misrouted, please forward to the correct contact person and reply to this communication with the appropriate contact information.
